text: It was not in Miss Crawford ’s power to talk Fanny into any real forgetfulness of what had passed .
text_tokenized: It was not in Miss Crawford ’s power to talk Fanny into any real forgetfulness of what had passed .

text: When the evening was over , she went to bed full of it , her nerves still agitated by the shock of such an attack from her cousin Tom , so public and so persevered in , and her spirits sinking under her aunt ’s unkind reflection and reproach .
text_tokenized: When the evening was over , she went to bed full of it , her nerves still agitated by the shock of such an attack from her cousin Tom , so public and so persevered in , and her spirits sinking under her aunt ’s unkind reflection and reproach .

text: To be called into notice in such a manner , to hear that it was but the prelude to something so infinitely worse , to be told that she must do what was so impossible as to act ; and then to have the charge of obstinacy and ingratitude follow it , enforced with such a hint at the dependence of her situation , had been too distressing at the time to make the remembrance when she was alone much less so , especially with the superadded dread of what the morrow might produce in continuation of the subject .
text_tokenized: To be called into notice in such a manner , to hear that it was but the prelude to something so infinitely worse , to be told that she must do what was so impossible as to act ; and then to have the charge of obstinacy and ingratitude follow it , enforced with such a hint at the dependence of her situation , had been too distressing at the time to make the remembrance when she was alone much less so , especially with the superadded dread of what the morrow might produce in continuation of the subject .

text: Miss Crawford had protected her only for the time ; and if she were applied to again among themselves with all the authoritative urgency that Tom and Maria were capable of , and Edmund perhaps away , what should she do ?
text_tokenized: Miss Crawford had protected her only for the time ; and if she were applied to again among themselves with all the authoritative urgency that Tom and Maria were capable of , and Edmund perhaps away , what should she do ?

text: She fell asleep before she could answer the question , and found it quite as puzzling when she awoke the next morning .
text_tokenized: She fell asleep before she could answer the question , and found it quite as puzzling when she awoke the next morning .

text: The little white attic , which had continued her sleeping - room ever since her first entering the family , proving incompetent to suggest any reply , she had recourse , as soon as she was dressed , to another apartment more spacious and more meet for walking about in and thinking , and of which she had now for some time been almost equally mistress .
text_tokenized: The little white attic , which had continued her sleeping - room ever since her first entering the family , proving incompetent to suggest any reply , she had recourse , as soon as she was dressed , to another apartment more spacious and more meet for walking about in and thinking , and of which she had now for some time been almost equally mistress .

text: It had been their school - room ; so called till the Miss Bertrams would not allow it to be called so any longer , and inhabited as such to a later period .
text_tokenized: It had been their school - room ; so called till the Miss Bertrams would not allow it to be called so any longer , and inhabited as such to a later period .

text: There Miss Lee had lived , and there they had read and written , and talked and laughed , till within the last three years , when she had quitted them .
text_tokenized: There Miss Lee had lived , and there they had read and written , and talked and laughed , till within the last three years , when she had quitted them .

text: The room had then become useless , and for some time was quite deserted , except by Fanny , when she visited her plants , or wanted one of the books , which she was still glad to keep there , from the deficiency of space and accommodation in her little chamber above : but gradually , as her value for the comforts of it increased , she had added to her possessions , and spent more of her time there ; and having nothing to oppose her , had so naturally and so artlessly worked herself into it , that it was now generally admitted to be hers .
text_tokenized: The room had then become useless , and for some time was quite deserted , except by Fanny , when she visited her plants , or wanted one of the books , which she was still glad to keep there , from the deficiency of space and accommodation in her little chamber above : but gradually , as her value for the comforts of it increased , she had added to her possessions , and spent more of her time there ; and having nothing to oppose her , had so naturally and so artlessly worked herself into it , that it was now generally admitted to be hers .

text: The East room , as it had been called ever since Maria Bertram was sixteen , was now considered Fanny ’s , almost as decidedly as the white attic : the smallness of the one making the use of the other so evidently reasonable that the Miss Bertrams , with every superiority in their own apartments which their own sense of superiority could demand , were entirely approving it ; and Mrs. Norris , having stipulated for there never being a fire in it on Fanny ’s account , was tolerably resigned to her having the use of what nobody else wanted , though the terms in which she sometimes spoke of the indulgence seemed to imply that it was the best room in the house .
text_tokenized: The East room , as it had been called ever since Maria Bertram was sixteen , was now considered Fanny ’s , almost as decidedly as the white attic : the smallness of the one making the use of the other so evidently reasonable that the Miss Bertrams , with every superiority in their own apartments which their own sense of superiority could demand , were entirely approving it ; and Mrs. Norris , having stipulated for there never being a fire in it on Fanny ’s account , was tolerably resigned to her having the use of what nobody else wanted , though the terms in which she sometimes spoke of the indulgence seemed to imply that it was the best room in the house .

text: The aspect was so favourable that even without a fire it was habitable in many an early spring and late autumn morning to such a willing mind as Fanny ’s ; and while there was a gleam of sunshine she hoped not to be driven from it entirely , even when winter came .
text_tokenized: The aspect was so favourable that even without a fire it was habitable in many an early spring and late autumn morning to such a willing mind as Fanny ’s ; and while there was a gleam of sunshine she hoped not to be driven from it entirely , even when winter came .

text: The comfort of it in her hours of leisure
text_tokenized: The comfort of it in her hours of leisure

text: was extreme .
text_tokenized: was extreme .

text: She could go there after anything unpleasant below , and find immediate consolation in some pursuit , or some train of thought at hand .
text_tokenized: She could go there after anything unpleasant below , and find immediate consolation in some pursuit , or some train of thought at hand .

text: Her plants , her books — of which she had been a collector from the first hour of her commanding a shilling — her writing - desk , and her works of charity and ingenuity , were all within her reach ; or if indisposed for employment , if nothing but musing would do , she could scarcely see an object in that room which had not an interesting remembrance connected with it .
text_tokenized: Her plants , her books — of which she had been a collector from the first hour of her commanding a shilling — her writing - desk , and her works of charity and ingenuity , were all within her reach ; or if indisposed for employment , if nothing but musing would do , she could scarcely see an object in that room which had not an interesting remembrance connected with it .

text: Everything was a friend , or bore her thoughts to a friend ; and though there had been sometimes much of suffering to her ; though her motives had often been misunderstood , her feelings disregarded , and her comprehension undervalued ; though she had known the pains of tyranny , of ridicule , and neglect , yet almost every recurrence of either had led to something consolatory : her aunt Bertram had spoken for her , or Miss Lee had been encouraging , or ,
text_tokenized: Everything was a friend , or bore her thoughts to a friend ; and though there had been sometimes much of suffering to her ; though her motives had often been misunderstood , her feelings disregarded , and her comprehension undervalued ; though she had known the pains of tyranny , of ridicule , and neglect , yet almost every recurrence of either had led to something consolatory : her aunt Bertram had spoken for her , or Miss Lee had been encouraging , or ,

text: what was yet more frequent or more dear , Edmund had been her champion and her friend : he had supported her cause or explained her meaning , he had told her not to cry , or had given her some proof of affection which made her tears delightful ; and the whole was now so blended together , so harmonised by distance , that every former affliction had its charm . The room was most dear to her , and she would not have changed its furniture for the handsomest in the house , though what had been originally plain had suffered all the ill - usage of children ; and its greatest elegancies and ornaments were a faded footstool of Julia ’s work , too ill done for the drawing - room , three transparencies , made in a rage for transparencies , for the three lower panes of one window , where Tintern Abbey held its station between a cave in Italy and a moonlight lake in Cumberland , a collection of family profiles , thought unworthy of being anywhere else , over the mantelpiece , and by their side , and pinned against the wall , a small sketch of a ship sent four years ago from the Mediterranean by William , with H.M.S. Antwerp at the bottom , in letters as tall as the mainmast .
text_tokenized: what was yet more frequent or more dear , Edmund had been her champion and her friend : he had supported her cause or explained her meaning , he had told her not to cry , or had given her some proof of affection which made her tears delightful ; and the whole was now so blended together , so harmonised by distance , that every former affliction had its charm . The room was most dear to her , and she would not have changed its furniture for the handsomest in the house , though what had been originally plain had suffered all the ill - usage of children ; and its greatest elegancies and ornaments were a faded footstool of Julia ’s work , too ill done for the drawing - room , three transparencies , made in a rage for transparencies , for the three lower panes of one window , where Tintern Abbey held its station between a cave in Italy and a moonlight lake in Cumberland , a collection of family profiles , thought unworthy of being anywhere else , over the mantelpiece , and by their side , and pinned against the wall , a small sketch of a ship sent four years ago from the Mediterranean by William , with H.M.S. Antwerp at the bottom , in letters as tall as the mainmast .

text: To this nest of comforts Fanny now walked down to try its influence on an agitated , doubting spirit , to see if by looking at Edmund ’s profile she could catch any of his counsel , or by giving air to her geraniums she might inhale a breeze of mental strength herself .
text_tokenized: To this nest of comforts Fanny now walked down to try its influence on an agitated , doubting spirit , to see if by looking at Edmund ’s profile she could catch any of his counsel , or by giving air to her geraniums she might inhale a breeze of mental strength herself .

text: But she had more than fears of her own perseverance to remove : she had begun to feel undecided as to what she _ ought _ _ to _ _ do _ ; and as she walked round the room her doubts were increasing .
text_tokenized: But she had more than fears of her own perseverance to remove : she had begun to feel undecided as to what she _ ought _ _ to _ _ do _ ; and as she walked round the room her doubts were increasing .

text: Was she _ right _ in refusing what was so warmly asked , so strongly wished for — what might be so essential to a scheme on which some of those to whom she owed the greatest complaisance had set their hearts ? Was it not ill - nature , selfishness , and a fear of exposing herself ?
text_tokenized: Was she _ right _ in refusing what was so warmly asked , so strongly wished for — what might be so essential to a scheme on which some of those to whom she owed the greatest complaisance had set their hearts ? Was it not ill - nature , selfishness , and a fear of exposing herself ?

text: And would Edmund ’s judgment , would his persuasion of Sir Thomas ’s disapprobation of the whole , be enough to justify her in a determined denial in spite of all the rest ?
text_tokenized: And would Edmund ’s judgment , would his persuasion of Sir Thomas ’s disapprobation of the whole , be enough to justify her in a determined denial in spite of all the rest ?

text: It would be so horrible to her to act that she was inclined to suspect the truth and purity of her own scruples ; and as she looked around her , the claims of her cousins to being obliged were strengthened by the sight of present upon present that she had received from them .
text_tokenized: It would be so horrible to her to act that she was inclined to suspect the truth and purity of her own scruples ; and as she looked around her , the claims of her cousins to being obliged were strengthened by the sight of present upon present that she had received from them .

text: The table between the windows was covered with work - boxes and netting - boxes which had been given her at different times , principally by Tom ; and she grew bewildered as to the amount of the debt which all these kind remembrances produced .
text_tokenized: The table between the windows was covered with work - boxes and netting - boxes which had been given her at different times , principally by Tom ; and she grew bewildered as to the amount of the debt which all these kind remembrances produced .

text: A tap at the door roused her in the midst of this attempt to find her way to her duty , and her gentle “ Come in ” was answered by the appearance of one , before whom all her doubts were wo nt to be laid .
text_tokenized: A tap at the door roused her in the midst of this attempt to find her way to her duty , and her gentle “ Come in ” was answered by the appearance of one , before whom all her doubts were wo nt to be laid .

text: Her eyes brightened at the sight of Edmund .
text_tokenized: Her eyes brightened at the sight of Edmund .

text: “ Can I speak with you , Fanny , for a few minutes ? ” said he .
text_tokenized: “ Can I speak with you , Fanny , for a few minutes ? ” said he .

text: “ Yes , certainly . ”
text_tokenized: “ Yes , certainly . ”

text: “ I want to consult .
text_tokenized: “ I want to consult .

text: I want your opinion . ”
text_tokenized: I want your opinion . ”

text: “ My opinion ! ” she cried , shrinking from such a compliment , highly as it gratified her . “ Yes , your advice and opinion .
text_tokenized: “ My opinion ! ” she cried , shrinking from such a compliment , highly as it gratified her . “ Yes , your advice and opinion .

text: I do not know what to do .
text_tokenized: I do not know what to do .

text: This acting scheme gets worse and worse , you see .
text_tokenized: This acting scheme gets worse and worse , you see .

text: They have chosen almost as bad a play as they could , and now , to complete the business , are going to ask the help of a young man very slightly known to any of us .
text_tokenized: They have chosen almost as bad a play as they could , and now , to complete the business , are going to ask the help of a young man very slightly known to any of us .

text: This is the end of all the privacy and propriety which was talked about at first .
text_tokenized: This is the end of all the privacy and propriety which was talked about at first .

text: I know no harm of Charles Maddox ; but the excessive intimacy which must spring from his being admitted among us in this manner is highly objectionable , the _ more _ than intimacy — the familiarity .
text_tokenized: I know no harm of Charles Maddox ; but the excessive intimacy which must spring from his being admitted among us in this manner is highly objectionable , the _ more _ than intimacy — the familiarity .

text: I can not think of it with any patience ; and it does appear to me an evil of such magnitude as must , _ if _ _ possible _ , be prevented .
text_tokenized: I can not think of it with any patience ; and it does appear to me an evil of such magnitude as must , _ if _ _ possible _ , be prevented .

text: Do not you see it in the same light ? ”
text_tokenized: Do not you see it in the same light ? ”

text: “ Yes ; but what can be done ?
text_tokenized: “ Yes ; but what can be done ?

text: Your brother is so determined .
text_tokenized: Your brother is so determined .

text: “ There is but _ one _ thing to be done , Fanny .
text_tokenized: “ There is but _ one _ thing to be done , Fanny .

text: I must take Anhalt myself .
text_tokenized: I must take Anhalt myself .

text: I am well aware that nothing else will quiet Tom . ” Fanny could not answer him .
text_tokenized: I am well aware that nothing else will quiet Tom . ” Fanny could not answer him .

text: “ It is not at all what I like , ” he continued .
text_tokenized: “ It is not at all what I like , ” he continued .

text: “ No man can like being driven into the _ appearance _ of such inconsistency .
text_tokenized: “ No man can like being driven into the _ appearance _ of such inconsistency .

text: After being known to oppose the scheme from the beginning
text_tokenized: After being known to oppose the scheme from the beginning

text: , there is absurdity in the face of my joining them _ now _ , when they are exceeding their first plan in every respect ; but I can think of no other alternative .
text_tokenized: , there is absurdity in the face of my joining them _ now _ , when they are exceeding their first plan in every respect ; but I can think of no other alternative .

text_tokenized: Can you , Fanny ?

text: “ No , ” said Fanny slowly , “ not immediately , but — ” “ But what ?
text_tokenized: “ No , ” said Fanny slowly , “ not immediately , but — ” “ But what ?

text: I see your judgment is not with me .
text_tokenized: I see your judgment is not with me .

text: Think it a little over .
text_tokenized: Think it a little over .

text: Perhaps you are not so much aware as I am of the mischief that _ may _ , of the unpleasantness that _ must _ arise from a young man ’s being received in this manner : domesticated among us ; authorised to come at all hours , and placed suddenly on a footing which must do away all restraints .
text_tokenized: Perhaps you are not so much aware as I am of the mischief that _ may _ , of the unpleasantness that _ must _ arise from a young man ’s being received in this manner : domesticated among us ; authorised to come at all hours , and placed suddenly on a footing which must do away all restraints .

text: To think only of the licence which every rehearsal must tend to create .
text_tokenized: To think only of the licence which every rehearsal must tend to create .

text: It is all very bad !
text_tokenized: It is all very bad !

text: Put yourself in Miss Crawford ’s place , Fanny .
text_tokenized: Put yourself in Miss Crawford ’s place , Fanny .

text: Consider what it would be to act Amelia with a stranger .
text_tokenized: Consider what it would be to act Amelia with a stranger .

text: She has a right to be felt for , because she evidently feels for herself .
text_tokenized: She has a right to be felt for , because she evidently feels for herself .

text: I heard enough of what she said to you last night to understand her unwillingness to be acting with a stranger ; and as she probably engaged in the part with different expectations — perhaps without considering the subject enough to know what was likely to be — it would be ungenerous , it would be really wrong to expose her to it .
text_tokenized: I heard enough of what she said to you last night to understand her unwillingness to be acting with a stranger ; and as she probably engaged in the part with different expectations — perhaps without considering the subject enough to know what was likely to be — it would be ungenerous , it would be really wrong to expose her to it .

text: Her feelings ought to be respected .
text_tokenized: Her feelings ought to be respected .

text: Does it not strike you so , Fanny ?
text_tokenized: Does it not strike you so , Fanny ?

text: “ I am sorry for Miss Crawford ; but I am more sorry to see you drawn in to do what you had resolved against , and what you are known to think will be disagreeable to my uncle .
text_tokenized: “ I am sorry for Miss Crawford ; but I am more sorry to see you drawn in to do what you had resolved against , and what you are known to think will be disagreeable to my uncle .

text: It will be such a triumph to the others ! ”
text_tokenized: It will be such a triumph to the others ! ”

text: “ They will not have much cause of triumph when they see how infamously I act .
text_tokenized: “ They will not have much cause of triumph when they see how infamously I act .

text: But , however , triumph there certainly will be , and I must brave it .
text_tokenized: But , however , triumph there certainly will be , and I must brave it .

text: But if I can be the means of restraining the publicity of the business , of limiting the exhibition , of concentrating our folly , I shall be well repaid .
text_tokenized: But if I can be the means of restraining the publicity of the business , of limiting the exhibition , of concentrating our folly , I shall be well repaid .

text: As I am now , I have no influence , I can do nothing : I have offended them , and they will not hear me ; but when I have put them in good - humour by this concession , I am not without hopes of persuading them to confine the representation within a much smaller circle than they are now in the high road for .

text: This will be a material gain .
text_tokenized: This will be a material gain .

text: My object is to confine it to Mrs. Rushworth and the Grants .
text_tokenized: My object is to confine it to Mrs. Rushworth and the Grants .

text: Will not this be worth gaining ?
text_tokenized: Will not this be worth gaining ?

text: “ Yes , it will be a great point . ” “ But still it has not your approbation .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , it will be a great point . ” “ But still it has not your approbation .

text: Can you mention any other measure by which I have a chance of doing equal good ? ” “ No , I can not think of anything else . ” “ Give me your approbation , then , Fanny .

text: “ Oh , cousin ! ” “ If you are against me , I ought to distrust myself , and yet — But it is absolutely impossible to let Tom go on in this way , riding about the country in quest of anybody who can be persuaded to act — no matter whom : the look of a gentleman is to be enough .

text: Edmund was satisfied . “ I shall walk down immediately after breakfast , ” said he , “ and am sure of giving pleasure there .
text_tokenized: Edmund was satisfied . “ I shall walk down immediately after breakfast , ” said he , “ and am sure of giving pleasure there .

text: And now , dear Fanny , I will not interrupt you any longer .
text_tokenized: And now , dear Fanny , I will not interrupt you any longer .

text: You want to be reading .
text_tokenized: You want to be reading .

text: But I could not be easy till I had spoken to you , and come to a decision .
text_tokenized: But I could not be easy till I had spoken to you , and come to a decision .

text: Sleeping or waking , my head has been full of this matter all night .
text_tokenized: Sleeping or waking , my head has been full of this matter all night .

text: It is an evil , but I am certainly making it less than it might be .
text_tokenized: It is an evil , but I am certainly making it less than it might be .

text: If Tom is up , I shall go to him directly and get it over , and when we meet at breakfast we shall be all in high good - humour at the prospect of acting the fool together with such unanimity .
text_tokenized: If Tom is up , I shall go to him directly and get it over , and when we meet at breakfast we shall be all in high good - humour at the prospect of acting the fool together with such unanimity .

text: _ You _ , in the meanwhile , will be taking a trip into China , I suppose .
text_tokenized: _ You _ , in the meanwhile , will be taking a trip into China , I suppose .

text: How does Lord Macartney go on?”—opening a volume on the table and then taking up some others .
text_tokenized: How does Lord Macartney go on?”—opening a volume on the table and then taking up some others .

text: “ And here are Crabbe ’s Tales , and the Idler , at hand to relieve you , if you tire of your great book .
text_tokenized: “ And here are Crabbe ’s Tales , and the Idler , at hand to relieve you , if you tire of your great book .

text: I admire your little establishment exceedingly ; and as soon as I am gone , you will empty your head of all this nonsense of acting , and sit comfortably down to your table .
text_tokenized: I admire your little establishment exceedingly ; and as soon as I am gone , you will empty your head of all this nonsense of acting , and sit comfortably down to your table .

text: But do not stay here to be cold .
text_tokenized: But do not stay here to be cold .

text: He went ; but there was no reading , no China , no composure for Fanny .
text_tokenized: He went ; but there was no reading , no China , no composure for Fanny .

text: He had told her the most extraordinary , the most inconceivable , the most unwelcome news ; and she could think of nothing else .
text_tokenized: He had told her the most extraordinary , the most inconceivable , the most unwelcome news ; and she could think of nothing else .

text: To be acting !
text_tokenized: To be acting !

text: After all his objections — objections so just and so public !
text_tokenized: After all his objections — objections so just and so public !

text: After all that she had heard him say , and seen him look , and known him to be feeling .
text_tokenized: After all that she had heard him say , and seen him look , and known him to be feeling .

text: Could it be possible ?
text_tokenized: Could it be possible ?

text: Edmund so inconsistent !
text_tokenized: Edmund so inconsistent !

text: Was he not deceiving himself ?
text_tokenized: Was he not deceiving himself ?

text: Was he not wrong ?
text_tokenized: Was he not wrong ?

text: Alas !
text_tokenized: Alas !

text: it was all Miss Crawford ’s doing .
text_tokenized: it was all Miss Crawford ’s doing .

text: She had seen her influence in every speech , and was miserable .
text_tokenized: She had seen her influence in every speech , and was miserable .

text: The doubts and alarms as to her own conduct , which had previously distressed her , and which had all slept while she listened to him , were become of little consequence now .
text_tokenized: The doubts and alarms as to her own conduct , which had previously distressed her , and which had all slept while she listened to him , were become of little consequence now .

text: This deeper anxiety swallowed them up .
text_tokenized: This deeper anxiety swallowed them up .

text: Things should take their course ; she cared not how it ended .
text_tokenized: Things should take their course ; she cared not how it ended .

text: Her cousins might attack , but could hardly tease her .
text_tokenized: Her cousins might attack , but could hardly tease her .

text: She was beyond their reach ; and if at last obliged to yield — no matter — it was all misery now .
text_tokenized: She was beyond their reach ; and if at last obliged to yield — no matter — it was all misery now .

text: XVII It was , indeed , a triumphant day to Mr. Bertram and Maria .
text_tokenized: XVII It was , indeed , a triumphant day to Mr. Bertram and Maria .

text: Such a victory over Edmund ’s discretion had been beyond their hopes , and was most delightful .
text_tokenized: Such a victory over Edmund ’s discretion had been beyond their hopes , and was most delightful .

text: There was no longer anything to disturb them in their darling project , and they congratulated each other in private on the jealous weakness to which they attributed the change , with all the glee of feelings gratified in every way .
text_tokenized: There was no longer anything to disturb them in their darling project , and they congratulated each other in private on the jealous weakness to which they attributed the change , with all the glee of feelings gratified in every way .

text: Edmund might still look grave , and say he did not like the scheme in general , and must disapprove the play in particular ; their point was gained : he was to act , and he was driven to it by the force of selfish inclinations only .
text_tokenized: Edmund might still look grave , and say he did not like the scheme in general , and must disapprove the play in particular ; their point was gained : he was to act , and he was driven to it by the force of selfish inclinations only .

text: Edmund had descended from that moral elevation which he had maintained before , and they were both as much the better as the happier for the descent .
text_tokenized: Edmund had descended from that moral elevation which he had maintained before , and they were both as much the better as the happier for the descent .

text: They behaved very well , however , to _ him _ on the occasion , betraying no exultation beyond the lines about the corners of the mouth , and seemed to think it as great an escape to be quit of the intrusion of Charles Maddox , as if they had been forced into admitting him against their inclination .

text: A stranger among them would have been the destruction of all their comfort ” ; and when Edmund , pursuing that idea , gave a hint of his hope as to the limitation of the audience , they were ready , in the complaisance of the moment , to promise anything .

text_tokenized: It was all good - humour and encouragement .

text: Mrs. Norris offered to contrive his dress , Mr. Yates assured him that Anhalt ’s last scene with the Baron admitted a good deal of action and emphasis , and Mr. Rushworth undertook to count his speeches .

text: “ Perhaps , ” said Tom , “ Fanny may be more disposed to oblige us now .

text: Perhaps you may persuade _ her _ . ” “ No , she is quite determined .
text_tokenized: Perhaps you may persuade _ her _ . ” “ No , she is quite determined .

text: She certainly will not act . ”

text: “ Oh ! very well . ”

text: And not another word was said ; but Fanny felt herself again in danger , and her indifference to the danger was beginning to fail her already .
text_tokenized: And not another word was said ; but Fanny felt herself again in danger , and her indifference to the danger was beginning to fail her already .

text: There were not fewer smiles at the Parsonage than at the Park on this change in Edmund ; Miss Crawford looked very lovely in hers , and entered with such an instantaneous renewal of cheerfulness into the whole affair as could have but one effect on him .

text: “ He was certainly right in respecting such feelings ; he was glad he had determined on it . ”

text: And the morning wore away in satisfactions very sweet , if not very sound .
text_tokenized: And the morning wore away in satisfactions very sweet , if not very sound .

text: One advantage resulted from it to Fanny : at the earnest request of Miss Crawford , Mrs. Grant had , with her usual good - humour , agreed to undertake the part for which Fanny had been wanted ; and this was all that occurred to gladden _ her _ heart during the day ; and even this , when imparted by Edmund , brought a pang with it , for it was Miss
text_tokenized: One advantage resulted from it to Fanny : at the earnest request of Miss Crawford , Mrs. Grant had , with her usual good - humour , agreed to undertake the part for which Fanny had been wanted ; and this was all that occurred to gladden _ her _ heart during the day ; and even this , when imparted by Edmund , brought a pang with it , for it was Miss

text: Crawford to whom she was obliged — it was Miss Crawford whose kind exertions were to excite her gratitude , and whose merit in making them was spoken of with a glow of admiration .
text_tokenized: Crawford to whom she was obliged — it was Miss Crawford whose kind exertions were to excite her gratitude , and whose merit in making them was spoken of with a glow of admiration .

text: She was safe ; but peace and safety were unconnected here .
text_tokenized: She was safe ; but peace and safety were unconnected here .

text: Her mind had been never farther from peace .
text_tokenized: Her mind had been never farther from peace .

text: She could not feel that she had done wrong herself , but she was disquieted in every other way .
text_tokenized: She could not feel that she had done wrong herself , but she was disquieted in every other way .

text: Her heart and her judgment were equally against Edmund ’s decision
text_tokenized: Her heart and her judgment were equally against Edmund ’s decision

text: : she could not acquit his unsteadiness , and his happiness under it made her wretched .
text_tokenized: : she could not acquit his unsteadiness , and his happiness under it made her wretched .

text: She was full of jealousy and agitation .
text_tokenized: She was full of jealousy and agitation .

text: Miss Crawford came with looks of gaiety which seemed an insult , with friendly expressions towards herself which she could hardly answer calmly .
text_tokenized: Miss Crawford came with looks of gaiety which seemed an insult , with friendly expressions towards herself which she could hardly answer calmly .

text: Everybody around her was gay and busy , prosperous and important ; each had their object of interest , their part , their dress , their favourite scene , their friends and confederates : all were finding employment in consultations and comparisons , or diversion in the playful conceits they suggested .
text_tokenized: Everybody around her was gay and busy , prosperous and important ; each had their object of interest , their part , their dress , their favourite scene , their friends and confederates : all were finding employment in consultations and comparisons , or diversion in the playful conceits they suggested .

text: She alone was sad and insignificant : she had no share in anything ; she might go or stay ; she might be in the midst of their noise , or retreat from it to the solitude of the East room , without being seen or missed .
text_tokenized: She alone was sad and insignificant : she had no share in anything ; she might go or stay ; she might be in the midst of their noise , or retreat from it to the solitude of the East room , without being seen or missed .

text: She could almost think anything would have been preferable to this .
text_tokenized: She could almost think anything would have been preferable to this .

text: Mrs. Grant was of consequence : _ her _ good - nature had honourable mention ; her taste and her time were considered ; her presence was wanted ; she was sought for , and attended , and praised ; and Fanny was at first in some danger of envying her the character she had accepted .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Grant was of consequence : _ her _ good - nature had honourable mention ; her taste and her time were considered ; her presence was wanted ; she was sought for , and attended , and praised ; and Fanny was at first in some danger of envying her the character she had accepted .

text: But reflection brought better feelings , and shewed her that Mrs. Grant was entitled to respect , which could never have belonged to _ her _ ; and that , had she received even the greatest , she could never have been easy in joining a scheme which , considering only her uncle , she must condemn altogether .

text: Fanny ’s heart was not absolutely the only saddened one amongst them , as she soon began to acknowledge to herself .
text_tokenized: Fanny ’s heart was not absolutely the only saddened one amongst them , as she soon began to acknowledge to herself .

text: Julia was a sufferer too , though not quite so blamelessly .
text_tokenized: Julia was a sufferer too , though not quite so blamelessly .

text: Henry Crawford had trifled with her feelings ; but she had very long allowed and even sought his attentions , with a jealousy of her sister

text: She either sat in gloomy silence , wrapt in such gravity as nothing could subdue , no curiosity touch , no wit amuse ; or allowing the attentions of Mr. Yates , was talking with forced gaiety to him alone , and ridiculing the acting of the others .

text: For a day or two after the affront was given , Henry Crawford had endeavoured to do it away by the usual attack of gallantry and compliment , but he had not cared enough about it to persevere against a few repulses ; and becoming soon too busy with his play to have time for more than one flirtation , he grew indifferent to the quarrel , or rather thought it a lucky occurrence , as quietly putting an end to what might ere long have raised expectations in more than Mrs. Grant .
text_tokenized: For a day or two after the affront was given , Henry Crawford had endeavoured to do it away by the usual attack of gallantry and compliment , but he had not cared enough about it to persevere against a few repulses ; and becoming soon too busy with his play to have time for more than one flirtation , he grew indifferent to the quarrel , or rather thought it a lucky occurrence , as quietly putting an end to what might ere long have raised expectations in more than Mrs. Grant .

text: She was not pleased to see Julia excluded from the play , and sitting by disregarded ; but as it was not a matter which really involved her happiness , as Henry must be the best judge of his own , and
text_tokenized: She was not pleased to see Julia excluded from the play , and sitting by disregarded ; but as it was not a matter which really involved her happiness , as Henry must be the best judge of his own , and

text: as he did assure her , with a most persuasive smile , that neither he nor Julia had ever had a serious thought of each other , she could only renew her former caution as to the elder sister , entreat him not to risk his tranquillity by too much admiration there , and then gladly take her share in anything that brought cheerfulness to the young people in general , and that did so particularly promote the pleasure of the two so dear to her . “ I rather wonder Julia is not in love with Henry , ” was her observation to Mary .

text: “ I dare say she is , ” replied Mary coldly .

text: Think of Mr. Rushworth ! ”
text_tokenized: Think of Mr. Rushworth ! ”

text: “ You had better tell Miss Bertram to think of Mr. Rushworth .
text_tokenized: “ You had better tell Miss Bertram to think of Mr. Rushworth .

text: It may do _ her _ some good .
text_tokenized: It may do _ her _ some good .

text: I often think of Mr. Rushworth ’s property and independence , and wish them in other hands ; but I never think of him .
text_tokenized: I often think of Mr. Rushworth ’s property and independence , and wish them in other hands ; but I never think of him .

text: A man might represent the county with such an estate ; a man might escape a profession and represent the county . ” “ I dare say he _ will _ be in parliament soon .
text_tokenized: A man might represent the county with such an estate ; a man might escape a profession and represent the county . ” “ I dare say he _ will _ be in parliament soon .

text: When Sir Thomas comes , I dare say he will be in for some borough , but there has been nobody to put him in the way of doing anything yet .
text_tokenized: When Sir Thomas comes , I dare say he will be in for some borough , but there has been nobody to put him in the way of doing anything yet .

text: “ Sir Thomas is to achieve many mighty things when he comes home , ” said Mary , after a pause .
text_tokenized: “ Sir Thomas is to achieve many mighty things when he comes home , ” said Mary , after a pause .

text: “ Do you remember Hawkins Browne ’s ‘ Address to Tobacco , ’ in imitation of Pope ? — Blest leaf ! whose aromatic gales dispense To Templars modesty , to Parsons sense . I will parody them — Blest Knight ! whose dictatorial looks dispense To Children affluence , to Rushworth sense .
text_tokenized: “ Do you remember Hawkins Browne ’s ‘ Address to Tobacco , ’ in imitation of Pope ? — Blest leaf ! whose aromatic gales dispense To Templars modesty , to Parsons sense . I will parody them — Blest Knight ! whose dictatorial looks dispense To Children affluence , to Rushworth sense .

text: Will not that do , Mrs. Grant ?
text_tokenized: Will not that do , Mrs. Grant ?

text: Everything seems to depend upon Sir Thomas ’s return . ”
text_tokenized: Everything seems to depend upon Sir Thomas ’s return . ”

text: “ You will find his consequence very just and reasonable when you see him in his family , I assure you .
text_tokenized: “ You will find his consequence very just and reasonable when you see him in his family , I assure you .

text: I do not think we do so well without him .
text_tokenized: I do not think we do so well without him .

text: He has a fine dignified manner , which suits the head of such a house , and keeps everybody in their place .
text_tokenized: He has a fine dignified manner , which suits the head of such a house , and keeps everybody in their place .

text: Lady Bertram seems more of a cipher now than when he is at home ; and nobody else can keep Mrs. Norris in order .
text_tokenized: Lady Bertram seems more of a cipher now than when he is at home ; and nobody else can keep Mrs. Norris in order .

text: But , Mary , do not fancy that Maria Bertram cares for Henry .

text: Julia _ did _ suffer , however , though Mrs. Grant discerned it not , and though it escaped the notice of many of her own family likewise .
text_tokenized: Julia _ did _ suffer , however , though Mrs. Grant discerned it not , and though it escaped the notice of many of her own family likewise .

text: She had loved , she did love still , and she had all the suffering which a warm temper and a high spirit were likely to endure under the disappointment of a dear , though irrational hope , with a strong sense of ill - usage .
text_tokenized: She had loved , she did love still , and she had all the suffering which a warm temper and a high spirit were likely to endure under the disappointment of a dear , though irrational hope , with a strong sense of ill - usage .

text: Her heart was sore and angry , and she was capable only of angry consolations .
text_tokenized: Her heart was sore and angry , and she was capable only of angry consolations .

text: The sister with whom she was used to be on easy terms was now become her greatest enemy : they were alienated from each other ; and Julia was not superior to the hope of some distressing end to the attentions which were still carrying on there , some punishment to Maria for conduct so shameful towards herself as well as towards Mr. Rushworth .
text_tokenized: The sister with whom she was used to be on easy terms was now become her greatest enemy : they were alienated from each other ; and Julia was not superior to the hope of some distressing end to the attentions which were still carrying on there , some punishment to Maria for conduct so shameful towards herself as well as towards Mr. Rushworth .

text: With no material fault of temper , or difference of opinion , to prevent their being very good friends while their interests were the same , the sisters , under such a trial as this , had not affection or principle enough to make them merciful or just , to give them honour or compassion .
text_tokenized: With no material fault of temper , or difference of opinion , to prevent their being very good friends while their interests were the same , the sisters , under such a trial as this , had not affection or principle enough to make them merciful or just , to give them honour or compassion .

text: Maria felt her triumph , and pursued her purpose , careless of Julia ; and Julia could never see Maria distinguished by Henry Crawford without trusting that it would create jealousy , and bring a public disturbance at last .
text_tokenized: Maria felt her triumph , and pursued her purpose , careless of Julia ; and Julia could never see Maria distinguished by Henry Crawford without trusting that it would create jealousy , and bring a public disturbance at last .

text: Fanny saw and pitied much of this in Julia ; but there was no outward fellowship between them .
text_tokenized: Fanny saw and pitied much of this in Julia ; but there was no outward fellowship between them .

text: Julia made no communication , and Fanny took no liberties .
text_tokenized: Julia made no communication , and Fanny took no liberties .

text: They were two solitary sufferers , or connected only by Fanny ’s consciousness .
text_tokenized: They were two solitary sufferers , or connected only by Fanny ’s consciousness .

text: The inattention of the two brothers and the aunt to Julia ’s discomposure , and their blindness to its true cause , must be imputed to the fullness of their own minds .
text_tokenized: The inattention of the two brothers and the aunt to Julia ’s discomposure , and their blindness to its true cause , must be imputed to the fullness of their own minds .

text: They were totally preoccupied .
text_tokenized: They were totally preoccupied .

text: Tom was engrossed by the concerns of his theatre , and saw nothing that did not immediately relate to it .
text_tokenized: Tom was engrossed by the concerns of his theatre , and saw nothing that did not immediately relate to it .

text: Edmund , between his theatrical and his real part , between Miss Crawford ’s claims and his own conduct , between love and consistency , was equally unobservant ; and Mrs. Norris was too busy in contriving and directing the general little matters of the company , superintending their various dresses with economical expedient , for which nobody thanked her , and saving , with delighted integrity , half a crown here and there to the absent Sir Thomas , to have leisure for watching the behaviour , or guarding the happiness of his daughters .
